summary: PHP 7.4 docblock annotations were not recognized by the SDK, which only supported PHP 8 attributes. The client would throw an error claiming the required attribute was missing even when using docblock-style annotations that should be compatible with the minimum supported PHP 7.4 version.
userImpact: Users targeting PHP 7.4 could not use the SDK with docblock-style annotations, forcing them to upgrade to PHP 8 or switch to attribute syntax despite the declared minimum version support.
rootCause: The WorkflowClient only supported PHP 8 attributes and did not fall back to parsing docblock-style annotations, despite PHP 7.4 being the minimum supported version in composer.json.
proposedFix: Add docblock annotation parsing support to WorkflowClient (similar to the implementation that likely existed elsewhere in the SDK).
resolutionDetails: Fixed in SDK 1.0.2+ by adding docblock annotation support to the WorkflowClient, likely mirroring existing implementation patterns used in other parts of the codebase.
keyQuote: the SDK is unable to parse my workflows because I'm not using PHP 8 style attributes, but older PHP 7.4 docblock style
